an5.176:1.1: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍika, escorted by around five hundred lay followers, went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:
an5.176:2.1: “Householders, you have supplied the mendicant Saṅgha with robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
an5.176:2.2: But you should not be content with just this much.
an5.176:2.4: So you should train like this:
an5.176:2.5: ‘How can we, from time to time, enter and dwell in the rapture of seclusion?’
an5.176:3.1: When he said this, Venerable Sāriputta said to the Buddha,
an5.176:3.3: How well said this was by the Buddha:
an5.176:3.4: ‘Householders, you have supplied the mendicant Saṅgha with robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick.
an5.176:3.5: But you should not be content with just this much.
an5.176:3.7: So you should train like this:
an5.176:3.8: “How can we, from time to time, enter and dwell in the rapture of seclusion?”
an5.176:3.10: At a time when a noble disciple enters and dwells in the rapture of seclusion, five things aren’t present in him.
an5.176:3.11: The pain and sadness connected with sensual pleasures.
an5.176:3.12: The pleasure and happiness connected with sensual pleasures.
an5.176:3.13: The pain and sadness connected with the unskillful.
an5.176:3.14: The pleasure and happiness connected with the unskillful.
an5.176:3.15: The pain and sadness connected with the skillful.
an5.176:3.16: At a time when a noble disciple enters and dwells in the rapture of seclusion, these five things aren’t present in him.”
an5.176:4.2: At a time when a noble disciple enters and dwells in the rapture of seclusion, five things aren’t present in him.
an5.176:4.3: The pain and sadness connected with sensual pleasures.
an5.176:4.4: The pleasure and happiness connected with sensual pleasures.
an5.176:4.5: The pain and sadness connected with the unskillful.
an5.176:4.6: The pleasure and happiness connected with the unskillful.
an5.176:4.7: The pain and sadness connected with the skillful.
an5.176:4.8: At a time when a noble disciple enters and dwells in the rapture of seclusion, these five things aren’t present in him.”
